Build ID: M20071023-1652

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Create a new Eclipse RCP project.
2. Try to profile it with TPTP
3. Exception get

However, if I try to reproduce the issue with a simple multiple pages editor, I cannot get this exception. Would you let me know how can I give more information for you for resolving this issue.

This issue already discussed at http://dev.eclipse.org/newslists/news.eclipse.tptp/msg04579.html , but look like cannot resolve at the end.

Hi Carfield, which version/vendor of Java, which version of TPTP and for which platform did you try to profile?

Also, can you attach the Eclipse error log?

> which version/vendor of Java, 

1.6.0

> which version of TPTP and for which platform did you try to profile?

4.3.1 at Windows XP.

> Also, can you attach the Eclipse error log?

You mean the the complete log other than the exception? Sure, tomorrow when I back to office
Both yourself and the URL you reference report using a package called BlueWorXBuilder. Would you be able to remove this dependency and try again?
I have totally no idea what that is... let me try to find that out at office

Ok, get a workaround, see if you think this is a bug in spring or TPTP or JDK.

If we unzip the jar eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.instrumentation_4.3.1.v200709261752\cbeModel.jar and change the file commons-logging.properties to not use that class, i.e.:


# NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_VAR
# NLS_ENCODING=UTF-8

org.apache.commons.logging.LogFactory = org.apache.commons.logging.impl.LogFactoryImpl
org.apache.commons.logging.Log = org.apache.commons.logging.impl.Log4JLogger


Then, the issue go away. May be we use spring in a wrong way and trigger this issue? Otherwise all program using spring have problem with TPTP :-/
Interesting..... would you be able to try with TPTP 4.4.0.3 and see if you get the same results?

I already using latest 4.4.1 version of TPTP from update site, 4.3.1 is only refer to JVMPI client. 

Or you refer to 4.4.0.3 of JVMPI client? Where can I get it?

FYI if you're using Java 6 then you're actually using the JVMTI agent, rather than the JVMPI agent. Another question, are you using the latest version from the update site? If so, it's 4.4.0.3, despite what it claims in the plugin properties ;) 

If you create a new workspace, create a new Java project, and tjem try to profile an Eclipse RCP application, does that work?
The latest version of the TPTP plugins, from the update site, that is....
I would believe it can be reproduct so far if there is any library that use static block to init logger, let me try a simiple example later.

It's unclear to me why the TPTP logging code (eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.instrumentation_4.3.1.v200709261752\cbeModel.jar) is even being called here. Are you including any of the TPTP classes as dependencies in your application?  

Would you be able to put together a simple test case that reproduces the problem? It sounds like you're almost there, already.
